snippet: After 162 games baseball has provided enough information to give well-reasoned answers on what to expect. But it’s now the postseason and one truth has emerged: Nobody knows anything.
abstract: Tyler Kepner On Baseball column holds that baseball reveals itself slowly, and though after 162 games there should be enough information to give well-reasoned answers on what to expect in the postseason, truth is that nobody really knows what will happen in October.
lead_paragraph: After 162 games baseball has provided enough information to give well-reasoned answers on what to expect. But it’s now the postseason and one truth has emerged: Nobody knows anything.

headline.main: In October, Exceptions Rule, Most of the Time
headline.print_headline: Exceptions Rule in October, Most of the Time
